oracle_info.speaker: lynne neagle am
oracle_info.content: As I said, the purpose of the meeting is to undertake Stage 2 proceedings on the Children (Abolition of Defence of Reasonable Punishment) (Wales) Bill.

oracle_info.speaker: lynne neagle am
oracle_info.content: My intention is to try to dispose of all amendments during today's meeting.

oracle_info.speaker: lynne neagle am
oracle_info.content: So, we will proceed, then, to group 1, which is the duty to promote public awareness.

oracle_info.speaker: lynne neagle am
oracle_info.content: I therefore take a vote by show of hands.

oracle_info.speaker: lynne neagle am
oracle_info.content: So, there voted four in favour, two against, and amendment 1 is agreed.

oracle_info.speaker: lynne neagle am
oracle_info.content: That takes us on to group 3, which relates to the regulation-making powers in the Bill.

oracle_info.speaker: lynne neagle am

oracle_info.speaker: lynne neagle am

specific_query_list.query: How did the Deputy Minister speak to her amendments in group 1 that related to the duty to promote public awareness?

oracle_info.speaker: julie morgan am
oracle_info.content: My amendments 1 and 4 will place a duty on Welsh Ministers to provide information and increase awareness about the change in the law to ensure that the public are made aware of how the law will change as a result of the defence of reasonable punishment being abolished and that physical punishment would be prohibited once the Act commences.

oracle_info.speaker: julie morgan am
oracle_info.content: I've already made a commitment to a high-intensity awareness-raising campaign over approximately six years from Royal Assent, should the Bill be passed.

oracle_info.speaker: julie morgan am
oracle_info.content: I've considered amendments 1A to 1E, which have been tabled by Janet Finch-Saunders, and which relate to the duty to raise awareness.

oracle_info.speaker: julie morgan am
oracle_info.content: I'm asking for the support of Members for amendments 1 and 4, and I ask Members to reject amendments 1A to 1E because this would place unnecessary provisions on the face of the Bill.

oracle_info.speaker: julie morgan am
oracle_info.content: If we go through them, amendment 1A is really open-ended on promoting public awareness.

oracle_info.speaker: julie morgan am
oracle_info.content: All the points that you've been making will be being considered by that group.

oracle_info.speaker: julie morgan am
oracle_info.content: I think the level of detail on the face of the Bill is not needed.

oracle_info.speaker: julie morgan am
oracle_info.content: And then amendment 1C—the information about how to raise concerns—I do repeat that safeguarding is everybody's business, and the same issues apply now as will after this defence has been removed.

specific_query_list.query: What did Janet Finch-Saunders say for amendments 1A to 1E when discussing the amendments in group 1 that related to the duty to promote public awareness?

oracle_info.speaker: janet finch-saunders am
oracle_info.content: While we believe it is absolutely imperative that the public are made aware of this controversial change in the law, the Deputy Minister's amendment lacks a number of key points that the committee were actually keen to address at Stage 1.

oracle_info.speaker: janet finch-saunders am
oracle_info.content: An important thread runs throughout each and every amendment that I've tabled within this group—that of a sustained awareness campaign, which not only stretches beyond the implementation of the Bill, but serves as a duty for future administrations.

oracle_info.speaker: janet finch-saunders am
oracle_info.content: Should our amendment to be agreed, we also request that a printing change be made to ensure that the new heading reflects promoting awareness of the changes to the law made by section 1.

oracle_info.speaker: janet finch-saunders am
oracle_info.content: However, this is only an online resource and she must be clear about what other avenues will be available to parents who do not have access to the internet or are part of harder-to-reach groups.

oracle_info.speaker: julie morgan am

oracle_info.content: Deputy Minister.

oracle_info.speaker: lynne neagle am
oracle_info.content: Deputy Minister.

oracle_info.speaker: julie morgan am
oracle_info.content: I can understand that the Member is concerned about the impact of this Bill on public services, but you will see from the explanatory memorandum and from the raft of impact statements published with the Bill that we've done a thorough and extremely diligent job of considering the potential impacts of this Bill before introduction.

oracle_info.speaker: julie morgan am
oracle_info.content: I just want to say again that the Bill is removing a defence to an offence of common assault, which has formed part of the common law of England and Wales for a very long time.

oracle_info.speaker: julie morgan am
oracle_info.content: And social services already receive and investigate reports of children being assaulted, including from health and education, so it's not a whole new area of costly activity for any of them.

oracle_info.speaker: julie morgan am
